intro: Mesosphaerum multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded shrub form. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a dense foliage that helps it thrive in dry conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
